cards.title: Crowther Lab
cards.lead: The Crowther Lab team at ETH Zurich uses ecosystem science to address biodiversity loss and climate change

description.title: Reforestation Projects
description.text:
The globe in the background show diverse projects around the world helping the reforestation progress in cooperation with the Crowther Lab.

Click on the button below to get to the interactive visualization that shows more information about each project.

cards.title: Multitouch Table – ACT NOW!
cards.lead: Projects created by Interaction Design students in cooperation with the Crowther Lab to visualize the potential of reforestation.

description.title: About the Projects
description.text:
The exercise was to create an application for the multitouch table where the user can experience the potential of global reforestation.

By using the tokens and changing various parameters, the user should be able to influence the overall situation. For this purpose we should use the reforestation data gathered by the Crowther Lab, as well as other data that would be relevant for our project.

cards.title: Interaction Design ZHdK
cards.lead: We deal with interfaces between people, products and services with the aim of making them as useful and enriching as possible.

description.title: About the Studies
description.text:
Students of the bachelor's degree study Interaction Design at ZHdK learn to design and realize digital products and systems such as smartphone apps, social media platforms, interactive objects, materials and environments.

They acquire basic digital craftsmanship and develop a sound understanding of user experience, 2D and 3D media and sonic interaction.

cards.title: WW
cards.lead: In the project WW the user can change the used potential of different co2 reduction projects....

description.title: How it works
description.text: With the so called tokens the user can select a Project Drawdown sector and change its used potential. With this interaction the potential can be made visible. The user realised how much reduction each sector can provide. But in the end every action counts to reduce the global emissions to an acceptable level.

cards.title: Above and Below
cards.lead: Above and Below shows up multiple graphs that visualise where and how the carbon is stored throughout the world.

description.title: How it works
description.text:
Comparing how the stocks looked in 2000, to the predicted and potential calculated futures in 2050.

Using the tokens one can explore the direct impact we can have on the malleable future and how this effects the temperature in a direct way.

cards.title: Reforest
cards.lead: Making climate change visible — by visualising projected GHG emissions on a global scale and proposing reforestation as a solution.

description.title: How it works
description.text:
Visualising the climate change's impacts and showcasing certain solution scenarios which could improve the outcome of the climate crisis we are facing.

The user can navigate through the map and change the reforestation parameter to view its compensation effect on global CO2 emissions.

cards.title: treeable
cards.lead: The project treeable visualizes the emissions of CO2 by the top 10 countries as well as the globally reforestation potential by pointing out the top 6 countries.

description.title: How it works
description.text: The user can interactively and playfully learn more about the reforestation potential and CO2 emissions. By turning the tokens, the user can explore the top 10 countries of CO2 Emissions and the top 6 countries with the biggest potential for reforestation. It gets parallel visualized on the global map. It should showcase one of the solutions that we have, to stop climate change.

cards.title: CO-CO-CO2
cards.lead: Playful interactive visualization of CO2 emissions and the reforestation potential around the globe displayed on the Multi Touch Table.

description.title: How it works
description.text: The visualization is constructed in a 4-way grid and each frame displays a different dataset. By placing the token anywhere in one of the frames, the values of the belonging dataset can be increased or decreased by rotating the token.

cards.title: Tree O Two
cards.lead: Interactive Visualisation of CO2-Emission Data and Reforestation Potential around the Globe on a Touchtable.

description.title: How it works
description.text: By moving the tokens on the table you can investigate on different areas on the world, by turning the tokens you can size the area which is shown. Tree O two connects the shown areas of CO2Emissions and Reforestation-potential and predicts the impact which it has on the global temperature.

cards.title: forty-seven
cards.lead: A program that runs on an interactive screen where users can explore the reforestation potential, as well as various CO2 emission factors in the world.

description.title: How it works
description.text: The user can control three different indicators, including the reforestation potential and the CO2 factors industry and electricity. By turning the tokens, one increases the number of factors, points on the map increase and become darker.

cards.title: Act Now!
cards.lead: We created a visualization that runs on an interactive Screen, to show which remarkable changes could happen if we would start to reforest.

description.title: How it works
description.text: The contrasts, reforestation and CO2 emissions can be easy distinguished by complementary colour contrast and shape. The user can switch back and forth between the years 2020 - 2050, intended to communicate the CO2 added annually.

cards.title: One Two Tree
cards.lead: An interactive interface on a multitouch table where people can learn more about the impact of a forest on climate change.

description.title: How it works
description.text: We transformed the multitouch screen into an explorative world map. People are picked up from the first interaction with the token and the table. On the one hand through the dynamic structure of the interface and on the other hand, they are given specific information  at the beginning they are given information about their chosen location.

cards.title: Plants for Climate
cards.lead: We created an interactive table that teaches the user why and where we need to plant trees.

description.title: How it works
description.text: With a wooden token that can be moved over the table as an input device one can explore an interactive map of the world to find the perfect spots to plant a different kinds of trees. The goal is to plant as many trees as possible and reduce the CO2 in the world.

cards.title: Treevement
cards.lead: An interactive touch display that allows users to experience the potential of global reforestation in the fight against climate change.

description.title: How it works
description.text: Using tracking objects, users can explore how a lack of action will negatively impact the climate and the world’s ecosystems. In addition, users can plant trees in a mini time trial game to better understand their individual impact.

cards.title: FUTURE FOREST
cards.lead: We designed a playful approach for people to receive more information about climate change and what positive impact one newly planted tree could have.

description.title: How it works
description.text: If the tree-token will be placed on the screen, information about NGO’s in different biomes appeare. As it is an addaptive layout it is not important where visitor choose to place the token. By rotating the tree-token people can browse through the projects. Following the red line to the globe one can find the place of the projects on the world. Every project and its diverse biom is illustrated in an isometric view.
